titleStmt.title: Marion Fair v. Territory of Washington. Judge's Order.

bibl.title: Marion Fair v. Territory of Washington. Judge's Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla | S.S.

Whereas, application has been made, pursuant to statute to the Hon. E.P. Oliphant, Judge of the W.S. District Court, First judicial District, in said Territory, and an order granted for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for the body of M. Fair, who, it is alleged, is unlawfully restrained of his liberty.

Therefore, in the name of the United States, you are commanded to have the body of the said M. Fair - with the cause of his detention, _ forthwith before the Hon. E. P. Oliphant at Chambers in the city of Walla Walla, to do and recieve what shall be ordered concerning him and have then and there this writ.
Witness the Hon. E.P. Oliphant, Judge, and the seal of the Court, this 14th day of August, A.D. 1862
Writ of Habeas Corpus for M. Fair

In obedience to the within writ I have here the body of M. Fair, held by me under an order of W.P. Horton Justice of the Peace in and for Walla Walla County, upon a charge of Grand Larceny Walla Walla Aug. 13th 1862
div1.ab: Jm Buckley Sheriff of Walla Walla County and Washington Territory
div1.p: By O J Robuss under sheriff for said county & territory
